    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static int sum​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of the first n positive integers (1+2+...+n) return 0 if n is less than or equal to 0

      • product

        public static int product​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        product of the first n positive integers (1*2*...*n) return 1 if n is less than or equal to 0

      • sumSquares

        public static int sumSquares​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of the squares of the first n positive integers (1*1 + 2*2 + ... + n*n) return 0 if n is less than or equal to 0

      • sumEven

        public static int sumEven​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of all positive even numbers till n (including n) (2 + 4 + 6 + ... (n or n-1)) For example, if n = 8, return 2+4+6+8=20 if n = 5, return 2+4=6 return 0 if n is less than or equal to 1

      • sumOdd

        public static int sumOdd​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of all positive odd numbers till n (including n) (1 + 3 + 5+ ... (n or n-1)) For example, if n = 8, return 1+3+5+7=16 if n = 5, return 1+3+5=9 return 0 if n is less than or equal to 0

      • sumEvenSquares

        public static int sumEvenSquares​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of the squares of all positive even numbers up to n. (note, n itself may or may not be an even number) return 0 if n is less than or equal to 0 For example: n = 6, return 6*6 + 4*4 + 2*2 n = 9, return 8*8 + 6*6 + 4*4 + 2*2

      • sumOddSquares

        public static int sumOddSquares​(int n)
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        sum of the squares of all positive odd numbers up to n. (note, n itself may or may not be an odd number) return 0 if n is less than or equal to 0 For example: n = 6, return 5*5 + 3*3 + 1*1 n = 7, return 7*7 + 5*5 + 3*3 + 1*1

      • power

        public static int power​(int x,
                        int n)
        Parameters:
        x -
        n - : assume n is more than or equal to 0
        Returns:
        x to the power of n IMPORTANT: for any integer x, x to the power of 0 is 1

      • powerV2

        public static double powerV2​(int x,
                             int n)
        Parameters:
        x -
        n - (n COULD be negative)
        Returns:
        x to the power of n IMPORTANT: for any integer x, x to the power of 0 is 1 For example: power(2, 5) = 32 power(2, -3) = 0.125 power(-2, -3) = -0.125 power(3, -2) = 0.11111
